The village of Bižer is surrounded by fields and pastures, with castle Portet looming in the distance, a constant reminder of the feudal system that governs the life of the locals. The villagers are hardworking and resilient, eking out a living from the land and the trades they have honed over generations.

The village of Saverda is a dusty and bustling place, with narrow streets and buildings. Despite the arduous and often dangerous nature of their work, these villagers are a tight-knit community, bound together by a shared sense of purpose and a deep respect for the land. They know the secrets of clay, how to shape it, and finding the best veins to mine.
Zamak Akvitań

Located in the southwestern region of the dukedom lies its distinguished capital city of Akvitań. The cityscape is dominated by the majestic ducal castle, which stands as a testament to the grandeur of the region. The castle is renowned for its remarkable Lace Tower, a towering spire crafted with an intricate design of numerous windows, giving it the appearance of delicate stone lace.
Nestled in the shadow of Castle Akvitań, the village of Bajonn exudes charm and tranquillity. Surrounded by lush meadows, it is one of the more peaceful villages of the already tranquil dukedom.
Situated to the east of Castle Akvitań is the hamlet of Pu. Surrounded by vibrant fauna, Pu is a rather small hamlet with its quaint cottages and serene brook that winds through its centre.

Known for its skilled weavers, Chasparren thrives on its vibrant market, where the fruits of their labour are traded with fervour. The peasants, hardy and resourceful, draw strength from their close-knit community and the protective presence of the nearby castle.
Šatu Dypi

Standing as the pinnacle of Aquitainian fortification, Chateau DEpee is an awe-inspiring castle situated near the border of Bryjon. The castles origins can be traced back to Lord DEpees great-grandfather, a legendary adventuring knight known for his involvement in numerous feuds and exploits not unusual for an Aquitainian. Harnessing his accumulated wealth, he constructed this very fortress that would soon stand to defy all assailants for decades to come.
Deruva Libr

Situated on the far northern fringes of Akvitańs domain, Derrevin is marked by its proximity to the Forest of Châlons to its north. The villages once-thriving population has dwindled, its homes and streets displaying scars of past feuds.
Pessac remains its mark on the map for a reason; the popularity of its white wine vintage. Pessac wine is one of the best Aquitaine wines, valued for its light, crisp flavors and smooth undertows.
Ažo

Ažo stands as a bastion of agricultural resilience, proudly standing as one of the most fertile villages in the already fertile region. Its fertile farms yield an abundance of grains, providing sustenance for the entirety of the dukedom. The hard working peasants toil diligently to continue feeding the hungry people of Akvitań.
Zamak Liburn

Nestled within the farmlands of Akvitań, Castle Liburn rises as a bastion of elegance and refinement. Situated amidst rolling hills and verdant meadows, this picturesque castle exudes an air of tranquillity and grace that exemplifies the relative peace the dukedom is known for.

Known for its vast vineyards, Nerak once flourished as a centre of winemaking, but now the toil of its remaining inhabitants is relentless. Under the watchful eye of the ruling lord of Castle Liburn, the villagers of Nerak endure, their spirits tested by the harsh realities of their existence.
Ŭejnfliit

Perched on the northern outskirts of Castle Libourne, the village of Wainfleet presents a clear break in societal norms compared to the rest of Aquitaine. Wainfleet is where the pesant Grail Knight Ser Geg makes his court, and where numerous peasants flock to to become his... Squights.
Zamak Munfłonka

Rising majestically amidst the rugged landscapes of Akvitań is Castle Munfłonka. Perched atop a hill, this stronghold epitomises strength and strategic advantage. Its stonework, weathered by the passage of time, exudes an aura of ancient resilience.
Biarritz is a town south of Aquitaine Castle, near the border with Brionne.

Compared to its sister village of Bjarryc, the village of Ayherre serves as an idyllic retreat from the tumult of war, a sanctuary where weary adventurers find respite amidst the constant feuds of the dukedom. With fields of golden wheat stretching as far as the eye can see, Ayherres economy thrives on agriculture, its diligent farmers reaping the fruits of their labour.
Zamak Kiurmont

Just a stones throw away from the formidable walls of Castle Kiurmont lies the village of Bergerac. While relatively unremarkable, life in Gradignan is a delicate balance, as the peasants navigate the thin line between sustenance and boredom, no doubt thanks to its rather safe position.

Situated somewhat north of Castle Kiurmont is the humble hamlet of Bergerac. While the village does not get as much trade as its neighbouring settlements, it still benefits from the dukedoms more peaceful setting. Most of its traffic comes from its prosperous mining community thanks to the discovery of a silver deposit nearby.
Zamak Karkasson

The fortress city and the ducal capital of Karkasson, Castle Karkasson sits on an island surrounded by the river Songez. Due to the defensive location Castle Karkasson is designed to be more of a fortress rather than a city, however there is a small town attached to the castle that acts as a marketplace and hub for many travelers and Knights who seek services.
Located near the Border of Karkasson and Bryjon on the river Brienne, maintains a trusting relationship with the outlying villages of Lunel and Vauvert, having been trade partners for ages past.

Located at the base of the Irana Mountains, the village of Albi has been host to countless raids from Greenskin tribes. As such, the shepherds have become battle hardened and will defend their village from any oncoming monstrosities.
East of Karkasson lies the farm village of Cahors. Although not very populous, Cahors is an asset to Castle Karkasson, providing most of their grain to feed the fortress town.

Located in the Vaults , the City of Ciura is the capital of the Barony of Savoie. The region is influenced heavily by nearby Tilea, despite this the city and people are steadfastly loyal to Bretonnia. Holding the famed relic, the “Shroud of Gilles le Breton” the City of Ciura is a Pilgrimage site to all who follow the Lady of the Lake, and all who seek visions of the Lady.

Having been sacked by Greenskin invaders many times in the past, the population of Montebaun is very low. Being one of the few timber villages in carcassonne, the remaining peasants here are often worked to the bone.
Šana
Sitting south of the Kunel border and the river Brienne, the village of Šana is a small farming community that provides its grain to the City of Ciura.
Just west of Šana, along the Breinne river, the small land is home to many olive fields, worked tirelessly by the Tilean influenced Bretonnian peasants.
Tułuz

Located on the western border of Karkasson and at the base of the Irana Mountains, Tułuz is a vital defensive position that holds the River Niveau crossing, that separates the border of Karkasson and Estalia.
Kondum is a timber village located in the most north western part of Karkasson, that borders Estalia and the Duchy of Bryjon.

Nestled in the western Irana Mountains, Muret is a mining town that has become a fierce recruiting ground for Karkasson Knights. The peasants are avid blacksmiths and miners, and will not shy away from a fight with Greenskins.
Monteśkju

In the green pastures of western Karkasson lies the village of Monteśkju. The lush fields of green attract many breeds of Bretonnian Horse, which has made the village quite wealthy compared to most Bretonnian villages.
Łovarr

A small fortress settlement on the Southern Reach of Bretonnia near the Tilean border. Once besieged by the armies of Tilea, the siege turned to a massacre when Ser Der Raker broke the assailants single handedly.

In the eastern plains of Karkasson, Jenn sits just opposite of the village Pierpińjo on the river Pou. Just outside of Jenn lies the Burial Mound of Grundsnik, an orc warboss who was defeated many centuries ago. Orcs occasionally come here, seeking to reclaim Grundsniks treasure.
A small mining village on the eastern base of the Irana Mountains and the Western Vaults, the Village of Cugnaux are hardened miners, working iron for the city of Ciura and beyond.

At the crossing of the river Brienne and the river Pou, Eskalkas grows flax for the city of Ciura. Because of their Tilean lineage, Eskalkas is quite prosperous and rich compared to the surrounding villages.
Zamak Hudaru

Located near the borders of the Loren Forrest, Castle Hudaru is an ever watchful eye that stands at the base of the Vaults mountain range. Castle Hudaru is a key position for maintaining Bretonnian rule over the northern end of the Novalone Pass, as well as for guarding the Loren highway.
Solińjak La Ruž

Solińjak La Ruž is the last Bretonnian settlement along the Loren Highway. Travelers heading towards Kreutzhafen will typically pick up anything they need for the long journey there from the peasants here. The people here feel uncomfortably close to the Fey of Cavaroc, but relations with Athel Loren remain as amicable as possible.
Mun De Marso

A de facto marker for the border between Tilea and Bretonnia, Mont de Marsan sits in the Novalone Pass. Many people here are in fact Tileans who make their living facilitating trade between Karkasson and Miragliano.
Pierpińjo

On the coast of the river Pou, near where the tributary feeds into the Brienne, sits the village of Pierpińjo. Pierpińjo being so close to the Novalone Pass has a large Tilean influence on the people here.
Zamak Kunel
Pierraš

Perrach is a small farming community on the road between Castle Kunel and Mersu Dekłu. The peasants here nar to go towards the woods in any way, so in fear they are of the Fey who watch over them from the shade of the trees.

In the flatlands of Kunel, surrounded by a sea of grassgrasses and farmlands, is the village of Najju. The peasants here raise cattle on the fine grasses for most of the year. When it comes time to drive the cattle to market in Kunel, the village becomes nearly uninhabited, as most of the population leaves along with their cattle.
Nearly in the center of Kunel, Bézier is an immensely isolated village. The most notable thing about it is the small grail shrine at the northern end of the village.
Šyno

Šyno was founded as one of a score of settlements in the Massif Orcal mountains and is the only one still remaining. The peasants here recently found a vein of high quality iron, which has afforded the hamlet much extra protection and vigilance from its protectors.
Žja

Žja is an old timber enterprise, founded long ago to provide building material for the Dukedom. With only the fools willing to even step foot near the forest of the fey, Kunel sought out a new source of wood. Despite the dangers present in the Forest of Chalons, it is far safer to deal with the cloven ones than anger the elves.

On Mun-Dor, is the village of Mun-Dor. The silver mine here is far older than any current human settlement. The village was built here a few years ago, after the older settlement was razed by greenskins.
Zamak Bomarše

Castle Bomarše sits strategically between three important areas; Massif Orcal, the border with Parravun and the Loren forest. While Quenellian relations with the fey are… amicable, The Castle was built far enough from the border of the woods to prevent the wood elves interference with its walls such as at Castle Kunel.
Mersu Dekłu

Founded by Shallyan cultists, Mersu Dekłu has grown as those seeking cures for their ailments have begun to settle around the monastery in thanks. These supplicants have built small homes and tilled the land, providing for everything the cultists here need.
Munłak
At the foot of Massif Orcal, is the hamlet of Munłak. Munłak uses the terraces on the hills around them to grow line after line of grape vines, which are harvested for the tables of Nobles.
Sant Hudas
Sant Hudas is along the road that runs between Mersu Dekłu and Castle Kunel. The people here long ago found a large deposit of clay.
Zamak Karrar

Castle Carrad sits on the shore of the River Brienne near the border of Karkasson and the Forest of Loren. Its lord, Leofric Karrar, has inherited the fief in absentia. His father had given him permission to embark on his Grail Quest but as soon as Leofric left, his father grew gravely ill and passed into the arms of the Lady. Duke Tancred II has taken stewardship here until Leofric returns.

Nice is an old village, so old in fact that some Nobles suspect that the fey originally inhabited it. Despite this suspicion, the Fey have never disturbed the village, at least not in a manner particular compared to the normal demands and restrictions.
Łabiež
On the river Brienne, Łabiež sits mostly undisturbed by either invaders or their own lords. The people here are known for their cheese, which is commonly exported out of the Kingdom.
Along the road to Bryjon is the village of Grasse, named for the tall grasses that grow in this region of Bretonnia. The people here raise notably large cattle on the grasses.
Zamak Łahije
Castle Łahije is both a castle and a major river port along the River Brienne. Nearby is the Grave of Cuileux, a Quenellian holy site where the founder of the Dukedom is entered.
On the river Brienne, sits the large farming village of Bruss. It was established by its lord as a plantation to grow flax for the industries in Kunel.

Muntodra is an isolated community, known only for their cultivation of cotton on the fertile plains north of Castle Łahije. The village is remarkably close to the Grave of Cuileux, the people here are used to the sight of knights coming and going to pay their respects to the long dead hero.
Borderuž
Borderuž is the last stop on the road before the Quenellian - Brionnian border. There is a tavern in the village, catering to traveling knights and merchants.
Zamak Muziljon

In the abyssal, death-ridden swamps formed by the slowing of the River Grismerie, Castle Muziljon slowly descends into the boundless depths of Mousillons murky waters. Muziljon itself thrives on barter and trade within the walls itself, many believe even more unsavoury acts happen deep within the city. Laden with dark lit taverns, unsavoury brothels, and dens of thieves, Muziljon is a haven for the enemies of Bretonnia.
Lu Mare Mor

Located just north of Muziljon, Les Marais Mort is hidden just beyond a vast number of hills, called Les Collines de Charnel. The village is barebones and infested with peasants afflicted by various mutations, many believe the origin to be long lost diseases emanating from Le Collines de Charnel.
Horž

Residing on the northern bank of the Grismerie river, the small settlement of Horž houses many humans and mutants alike. Being even poorer than most Bretonnian settlements, Horž stays afloat with communal fishing and what little they can scratch out of the ground. When they arent levied into their lords armies.

La Grange, nicknamed “The Barn”, houses many steeds who would dare to graze into the foetid swamps of Muziljon. Although a breeding ground for livestock, it is also popular for mutants and humans that need safe dwelling from the foul creatures of the night.
Zamak Rašar

Across the border of Lioness, Castle Rašar is lorded over by none other than Lord Rašar himself. Surprisingly, these lands are fairly established and well kept considering Mousillons hellish landscape and numerous dangers. Some adventurers and villagers say they hear noises coming from the castle, however no one has ever investigated the ongoing activities within the castle.
Lu Ruźje Nuar

Not so much a village but more of a Tavern surrounded by makeshift homes, Lu Ruźje Nuar is a small gathering hub for many unwanted vagrants and shifty wanderers. Indeed it is remarkable the small village houses mostly humans and not any mutants. The few houses surrounding the village are home to the manystaff at Lu Ruźje Nuar.
Zamak Chan

A small hamlet that is isolated from most of Muziljon itself, Iremi is home to a great number of humans, rather than mutants. Many of the peasants residing in the village work for Lord Aucassin and work in his kitchen at Chateau Chan. Iremi does get some trade because of its closeness to Grenouille Gate however.
Kryvavaje Trymańnie

Once the home of a valiant order of Knights known as the Order of the Blood Dragon, or the Ordo Draconis. One fateful night, a Vampire known as Walach Harkon challenged every Knight to single combat, eventually turning all who he deemed worthy into Vampires. The entirety of the Ordo Draconis was then wiped from existence and became known as the Blood Dragons.
In Edrył Kojran

It is from the Kings Glade that Ariel and Orion preside over the realm of Athel Loren. They do not rule alone, but with the aid of a council. There are currently fifteen lords and ladies upon this council, drawn from the hidden realms that blossom beneath the trees. The Kings Glade is a vast and awesome clearing, surrounded by great oak trees of immense girth and antiquity.Although vast, this city is virtually invisible to the untrained eye. It merges into the forest and is easily missed by idle traveller and foe alike. Over the centuries, Spellweavers created a city among the trees around the Kings Glade. The branches of the great oaks were induced to entwine into walkways and canopies, galleries and vaults. Thus are the buildings and chambers made entirely of living trees, branches and foliage. Beneath the earth, the same methods have been used to create great hollows between the interwoven roots of the trees.
Tał Et Ajr

Tał Et Ajr is a woodelf settlement under the roof of the oak of ages. Forest spirits are very common in this area and interact a lot in the daily life of the Asrai. The village is surrounded by magical forest and is home to many shrines of the Asrai pantheons.
Tał Kułłon

The Asrai hall of Tał Kułłon is small settlement east from In Edrył Kojran and north of Tyr vanna. The region is filled with magic and has a high population of forest animals. Wild forest horses are numerous. The local elven population is really familiar with the horse herds roaming around. Every so often they bond with one of the horses and are able to ride them into battle.
Tał Hovarn
The Asrai hall of Tał Hovarn lies North of the oak of ages. The surrounding is one of the most fertile in Athel loren, it hosts many fields of wild fruit.
Tał Mieryjon
Skalnyja Zały Findola

Wydrioth, the Pine Crags, is a High Realm of Athel Loren, ruled by the Glade Lord Findoł and Lady Evelyne. It is an embattled region, ever beset by the Dwarfs and Greenskins of the Grey Mountains. the Pine Crags are in fact a sprawling fortress. Here, the Elves have shaped citadels and strongholds from skycrown oaks, and endless leagues of gnarled and tangled walls from rockbriar. A maze of walkways and root-braced tunnels bind the various outposts together into a single living defence-work capable of repelling a full-blown Attack.
Tał Žył-Fineł

The inhabitants of Tał Žył-Fineł are all combat experienced warriors for theve fought countless enemies coming from the grey mountains. The hall of Tał Žył-Fineł lies on the foot of the grey mountains. They are having numerous attacks on the forest from dwarves and greenskins whom try to lay waste to their beloved forest.
Tał Varyhan

Tał Varyhan is more often then not protecting it self from dwarven attacks. Dwarves try to destroy their forest and the inhabitants of Tał Varyhan put every resource they have into killing the invading dwarves. Tał Varyhans main product is silver spoils of war theyve got from the dwarven caravans and mines.

Atylwyth is eternally in winter, and it is rumored that its inhabitants hearts are made of ice. The Forest Spirits of the Winterheart are always sluggish or asleep, so the safety of the realm has always depended heavily on the elves. There are more Eternal Guard in Atylwyth than any other realm. It is a realm locked in the icy embrace of winter; its boughs are ever covered in a thick rime of frost, its glades always heavy with snow. Pale statues line every path, and mark the entrance to every hall. Some of these works are exquisite ice sculptures, shaped by an artisans patient touch. Others are frost-caged mischievous naiads or spiteful kelpies, imprisoned by Elven magics in punishment for past misdeeds or to prevent future ones. These statues flow and reform when the eye does not rest upon them, the creatures inside ever seeking to escape.
Tał Amier

The hall of Tał Amier is a hall covered in ice. It contains large acient ice sculptures depciting the Asrai pantheon. Tał Amier is heavily guarded with Eternal guard for its spirits are asleep. Sometimes voices are heard from the ice sculptures does it contain the gods voices or do they serve another purpose?
Tał Drost

The Trees of Tał Drost are pillars covered in snow and ice. the ice forms a roof above the hall that keeps the elves dry from snowfall. protected by the ice barrier from above the Asrai found a way to plant vegetation and have a consistent food source in this snow covered land.
Tał Mora
Zały Anaeret

Constructed by lord Anaereth during the Season of Rebirth, the Halls of Aneareth are the seat of Lady Tevaril and Lady Delynnas power. Mighty halls constructed under a great tree in the center of the Witherhold, the Halls have been fortified over the passage of time, especially since the corruption of Addaivoch.
Tał Chakan
Near the Balavalnyja Zały Tanca Vajny, the elves of Tał Chakan are often in a merry mood, either having just returned from the domain of Loec or are preparing to head that way again.
Tał Bryanda

The halls of Brianda lay south of the Zały Anaeret. The hall serves as a outpost keeping a look out on Castle Quenelles. The Hall of Tał Bryanda hosts many waywatchers who are trained to scout the edges of Athel Loren.
Tał Valeryn

A hall near the wild Heath, the empty wood and grasslands between Athel Loren proper and Bretonnia, Tał Valeryn is used to its fair share of hardship. This region is particularly vulnerable to the cloven ones incursions. Despite this, the elves here have no shortage in stubborn fortitude.
A hall near the Wysarian Ravine, Tal Rond serves as a watchout point, both against the forces that regularly gather around Addaivoch as well as nearby Parravon.
Balavalnyja Zały Tanca Vajny

Fyr Darric, the Tricksters Wood, is a High Realm of Athel Loren, ruled by Lady Heggria of the Masque. Fyr Darric is the Elven god Loec the Tricksters holy ground within Athel Loren, the site of many shrines to his anarchic glory. Here too can be found the Balavalnyja Zały Tanca Vajny, the closest thing that the nomadic Wardancers of Athel Loren have to a home. As a result, the glades of Fyr Darric always resound to the sound of laughter.
Trełłok
Trełłok is a mighty tree whos echos the songs and laughter of loec. Wardancers are often found near the tree laughing and dancing.
Prahał Viečnaj Poŭnačy

Modryn, the Night Glens is one of the twelve kingdoms of Athel Loren. It is ruled by Lady Morlanna and Lord Arlas. The thing that sets Modryn apart from all other realms of Athel Loren is the fact that it is eternally night there. When the Morathi poisoned Ariels soul, the darkness spread through the forest. However, the rest of the forest recovered with Ariel, but Modryn has remained dark ever since. The elves of Modryn are as dark as their surroundings. They practice dark magic there that would be forbidden in other parts of the Athel Loren.
Tał Stornas

The hall of Tał Stornas is a southern watch post made to repel Brettonian invaders from the dukedom of Carcasonne. No seconds chances are given for a captured human for dark sorcery will befall them as they enter Modryn.
Tałreńnik
Dark magic surrounds Tałreńnik for the Asrai living here are shrouded in darkness. Foreign wanderers coming close to Tałreńnik are never to be seen again.
Kavadła Vauła

Torgovann, also known as the Forge of Starlight is a realm in the Forest of Loren ruled by Lord Daith. Torgovann is the only area within Athel Loren where fire is a sacred symbol. Both a temple and a forge, Vauls Anvil is used every night to forge weapons. The local Forest Spirits are drawn to the raging fire, but keep their distance, for they know it to be extremely dangerous.
Tał Dovar

The hall of Dovar is one of the biggest supplier of crude iron for lord Daith. Day and night Vauls Anvil forges weapon. The never ending forge needs a never ending supply, for centuries the hall of Dovar has has given a answer to this call.
Zały Ekvosa

Cavaroc, the Skymark Reaches, is a High Realm of Athel Loren, ruled by Lord Edrael of Equos. It is the land of the meadow glades, the sparsely-wooded grassland plains that lie on Athel Lorens south border. The Elves of Cavaroc are horsemasters as fine as any in the world, and the first to march when the war-horns are sounded. They are swift to act, and swift to anger as well. it is all but a certainty that the Glade Riders of the Skymark Reaches will be found at the head of that mad charge.
Tał Amara

The Asrai from Tał Amara are born riders. For generations they have delivered the most fierce Glade riders in Athel loren. The inhabitats of the hall of Tał Amara are swift to be angered and are not afraid to use violence as a solution.
Tał Enda Varyan

Argwylon, or The Moonspring Glades is one of the twelve kingdoms of Athel Loren. It is ruled by Lord Thalandor Doomstar.The amount of magic in Argwylon far surpasses that of any other of the Forests realms. Here, miracles and wonders are performed daily. This is one rare place in Athel Loren where records of history are kept, similar to those in Ulthuan. The elves here are also the only ones in Athel Loren that know the ancient tongue of the Eagles. However, Argwylons elves are notoriously arrogant, and consider themselves superior to all other elves. It is a rare occurrence when an elf of another realm talks to an elf of Argwylon.
Łokrymier
Łokrymier lies between Tał Enda Varyan and the Waterfall palace of the Naiad Court. The tree serves as a outpost to watch Athel Lorens northern border.
Vadaspadny Pałac Domu Najad

The Naiad court is a place of light and wonder, where the rivers are alive with naiads, and the waterfalls sing with ghostly voices. The place has a natural defence system build with water, it has kept the spirits and elves that live here safe for ages.
Tał Est

Arranoc, also known as The Summerstrand is one of the twelve realms of Athel Loren. It is always summer in Arranoc, and in some parts night rarely falls. This causes the Forest Spirits in the Summerstrand to be especially strong. Arranoc is ruled by Amadri Ironbark, a former Wood Elf noble who later became a Tree Kin. Arranoc is under constant threat, because on its borders are the Vaults of Winter.
Letniaje Dreva

Letniaje Dreva is one of the biggest and most ancient trees of athel loren. It reaches sky high and absorbs it power from the sun. Many Asrai live under its roof were the shade protects them for the everlasting summer.
Tał Dryacha

Anmyr, the Witherhold, is a High Realm of Athel Loren, ruled by Lady Tevaril and Lady Delynna. It is a realm in desperate decline. Many years ago, the foul Beastlord Morghur was slain in the heart of the region, and his blood corrupted the land for many leagues around. Ever since those days, the Wood Elves of Anmyr have been fighting a losing battle against Morghurs taint. Each year, the Beastmen warherds grow larger, increasing numbers of forest spirits are lost to madness and whole groves of trees wither and perish. In Athel Loren, the loss of even a single tree is a tragedy, so the ongoing legacy of Morghurs blood is cause for sorrow beyond words.
Tał Siłvoch

The Asrai hall of Tał Siłvoch are filled with the most anarchic followers of the trickster god Loec. Every so often the nomadic wardancers appear to drink,dance, laugh and love... Only to dissapear the following morning and never to be seen again.
Cir Vanna

Cythral, the Wildwood, is a High Realm of Athel Loren, ruled by Lady Draya the Nighthawk. Not all the spirits of Athel Loren dwell in harmony with the Elves. Even now, thousands of years after the first great council, there are those beings who actively seek the Elves destruction. Some revel in malevolence purely for its own sake, others would war against the Elves with all the cunning and might at their command, were they free to do so. It was to guard against this threat that the first Wood Elves planted a fence of waystones in the southeast of Athel Loren, creating the Wildwood — a prison for the most malevolent of forest spirits. Cir Vanna serves as the main stronghold of the Wildwood hosting a strong security and many look outs.
Cir Edrełł
